page.title: 06The Mires,Snape, Yorkshire.
page.content: The Mires are found at the north east end of the village.There are 3 farms there.The farmers use the fields for crops,pasture and hay.The Mires flood in winter and in heavy rain.The rain washes away the fertiliser and kills worms that are in the soil.In the early 19th century the Mires were drained by means of stells.Some of the stells are very deep.The Mires is a pleasant place to go for a walk because it is quiet.There are 2 lanes to walk down.There is quite a lot of wildlife to be seen including foxes, deer and rabbits.
